column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Arrange a Classroom for Tuition Kids in Your Home
#Text=Some of us here have a lot of problem while we 're taking children for learning , through tuition , and more trouble if it 's in the home .
#Text=Let 's do it !
#Text=Let 's find out how to maintain a perfect classroom for them , right under your roof !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Your room has to be pretty spaciously built .
#Text=If it is a smaller room , call different children at different times .
#Text=This will also help you build your stamina , and stop confusion in the kids .
#Text=The size of the room will now fit the children .
#Text=The lowest you can get for a small room is to take four kids at a time .
#Text=Gather all the waste .
#Text=To maintain the classroom , you 'll need plenty of things you decided to trash in the barn or give to the garbage-picker .
#Text=Take out that chair !
#Text=Get those tables !
#Text=Where is that drawer you saved a few years ago , and forgot all about it ?
#Text=Get the room to be painted brightly .
#Text=With the exception of red , any color will be suitable .
#Text=The colors should be bright , but not hyper .
#Text=If it 's pale pink , add a combination of purple and yellow !
#Text=If it 's red , give it a tinge of orange or green !
#Text=Give it a slightly entertaining twitch .
#Text=Design a peaceful-looking garden with birds flying .
#Text=Paint a serene landscape .
#Text=If you want to spend a lot for those little children , get a wallpaper .
#Text=Do NOT choose a wallpaper which has congested designs , as this will psychologically effect the child 's attentiveness .
#Text=Organize everything .
#Text=Organizing will help you not to get flustered and effect the way children look at you .
#Text=Make a resource-pocket right beside a white-board , or a blackboard you will use .
#Text=In it keep all the stationery .
#Text=Keep a cupboard neatly designed and in it , put your necessary belongings there .
#Text=Keep entertaining items to get your children more interested .
#Text=This not only effects their keenness , but also their thinking skills and sharpness of mind .
#Text=Arrange two tables in a row with four chairs , or as many as the kids you 're taking in .
#Text=At the front wall where their vision will mostly be , hang a blackboard or whiteboard .
#Text=Do NOT put your duster on a spare stool or chair , as the stains of chalk and dried ink from the marker will be hard to remove .
#Text=Keep a piece of cardboard over the stool , and let your duster rest there .
#Text=Hang a little basket at the other side of your board .
#Text=This will contain flashcards and all the other various entertainment item you 're going to use that day .
#Text=After you 're done with using those pieces , take out different ones from the cupboard , and put them in for the next day .
#Text=In the resource pocket , always have stationery .
#Text=This includes :
#Text=These are if the children , supposedly , lose their item or have n't brought any .
#Text=You can lend it to the for the time being until the time is over .
#Text=Color pencils
#Text=Pens
#Text=Pencils
#Text=Erasers
#Text=Sharpeners
#Text=Scales/rulers
#Text=Markers
#Text=Paint brushes
#Text=Crayons
#Text=Scissors
#Text=Keep a small dustbin at the far end of the room .
#Text=Instruct the children that all garbage should go there .
#Text=Ensure that there are no pencil-sharps on the ground .
#Text=At the other corner , keep a small decorated box with gift-wrapper or some bright-looking covering .
#Text=Put a label on it saying , " LOST ITEMS ' BOX " .
#Text=Make a small opening in this box .
#Text=Shove in anything that you find after your class .
#Text=Nail , stick or paste anything the children have created .
#Text=Example : - They 've given a test and the results will come tomorrow .
#Text=Check all papers and put them on the wall .
#Text=This will be called the Children 's Corner .
#Text=Keep a noticeboard .
#Text=On this noticeboard , you 'll stick everything which you 're currently teaching OR what the children have learnt .
#Text=Cut out stories from newspapers that might interest your kids .
#Text=Put a moral or some quote there as well .
#Text=This noticeboard has to be bright and attractive , so that your kids may read it .
#Text=In one corner , put a two-board table .
#Text=It will have one board on the top and one board at the bottom .
#Text=In the bottom keep papers , canvases and paints .
#Text=On the top , keep books tidily arranged .
#Text=This is for the children 's free-time .

#Text=After they have done everything and still time is remaining , with them idle , pass around the papers , canvases , books , paints , scissors , crayons , color pencils , pencils , pens and everything singly in your resource pocket .
#Text=It will relax their mind and make them happy , which urges them to come tomorrow .
#Text=Psychologically , they become at peace , and their mind is fresher and more eager and cheerful .
#Text=Memory also increases with this method .
